decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:0cm;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal;mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none"><span style="font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;
mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;
mso-font-kerning:0pt;mso-ligatures:none">The proposed ground floor front
extension, two storey side extension together with the alterations to the roof
to raise the ridge height, would result in the addition of significant bulk to
the property creating an incongruous and unduly obtrusive addition to the
original dwellinghouse which would fail to respect the character and proportions
of the dwellinghouse and the visual amenities of the locality and furthermore</span><font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 16px;">, erode the visual gap on this corner plot</span></font><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">. The cumulative
impact of the proposed ground floor front extension, two storey side extension
and raising of the ridge height of the roof would result in overdevelopment of
the host property.&nbsp; This is contrary to the high quality design aspiration of
the National Planning Policy Framework (2023</span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">), </span><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">Policy
D3 (D.1 and D.11) of The London Plan (2021), Policies DM1 A, B (a), (b) and (c)
of the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the
relevant provisions of the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document
Residential Design Guide (2010).</span></p>
description: Single storey front extension incorporation front porch, Two storey side extension, Single storey rear extension, Alterations to roof to raise ridge height, Rooflights in both side and rear roof slopes,  External alterations (Demolition of side and rear extensions)
